t: Thus*p saith the Lord,*s Keep ye judgment, and do justice: for my salvation is near to come, and my righteousness to be revealed.
Blessed*p is the man that doeth this, and the son of man that layeth hold on it; that keepeth the sabbath from polluting it, and keepeth his hand from doing any evil.

Neither*p let the son of the stranger, that hath joined himself to the Lord,*s speak, saying, The Lord*s hath utterly separated me from his people: neither let the eunuch say, Behold, I am a dry tree.
For*p thus saith the Lord*s unto the eunuchs that keep my sabbaths, and choose the things that please me, and take hold of my covenant;
Even*p unto them will I give in mine house and within my walls a place and a name better than of sons and of daughters: I will give them an everlasting name, that shall not be cut off.

Also*p the sons of the stranger, that join themselves to the Lord,*s to serve him, and to love the name of the Lord,*s to be his servants, every one that keepeth the sabbath from polluting it, and taketh hold of my covenant;

Even*p them will I bring to my holy mountain, and make them joyful in my house of prayer: their burnt offerings and their sacrifices shall be accepted upon mine altar; for mine house shall be called an house of prayer for all people.
The*p Lord God*s which gathereth the outcasts of Israel saith, Yet will I gather others to him, beside those that are gathered unto him.
All*p ye beasts of the field, come to devour, yea, all ye beasts in the forest.
His*p watchmen are blind: they are all ignorant, they are all dumb dogs, they cannot bark; sleeping, lying down, loving to slumber.
Yea,*p they are greedy dogs which can never have enough, and they are shepherds that cannot understand: they all look to their own way, every one for his gain, from his quarter.
Come*p ye, say they, I will fetch wine, and we will fill ourselves with strong drink; and to morrow shall be as this day, and much more abundant.
